data.name: Adaptive Snapjaw
data.oracle_text: Evolve (Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if that creature has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)
data.flavor_text:
"Eh, needs more toad."
—Gulistan, Simic biomancer

data.name: Aeromoeba
data.oracle_text:
Flying
Discard a card: Switch Aeromoeba's power and toughness until end of turn.
data.flavor_text: Some clouds heed no wind.

data.name: Affectionate Indrik
data.oracle_text: When Affectionate Indrik enters the battlefield, you may have it fight target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
data.flavor_text: The problem isn't the indrik's enthusiasm, it's Ravnica's lack of guardrails.

data.name: Alms Beast
data.oracle_text: Creatures blocking or blocked by Alms Beast have lifelink.
data.flavor_text: Alms-coins are only redeemable at Orzhov businesses.

data.name: Alpha Tyrranax
data.flavor_text: Hunger seized the tyrranax, and the Sylvok's vision quest ended in disaster.

data.name: Anurid Barkripper
data.oracle_text: Threshold — Anurid Barkripper gets +2/+2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
data.flavor_text: When it croaks, so do you.

data.name: Anurid Brushhopper
data.oracle_text: Discard two cards: Exile Anurid Brushhopper. Return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
data.flavor_text: It's so tough it can frighten *itself* into hiding.

data.name: Anurid Murkdiver
data.oracle_text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
data.flavor_text: Aphetto's swamps are alive with the dead.

data.name: Anurid Scavenger
data.oracle_text:
Protection from black
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Anurid Scavenger unless you put a card from your graveyard on the bottom of your library.
data.flavor_text: Krosa's topmost bottom feeder.

data.name: Anurid Swarmsnapper
data.oracle_text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
{1}{G}: Anurid Swarmsnapper can block an additional creature this turn.
data.flavor_text: Anurids have the problem of airborne invaders licked.

data.name: Aquamoeba
data.oracle_text: Discard a card: Switch Aquamoeba's power and toughness until end of turn.
data.flavor_text: Some tides need no moon.

data.name: Aquus Steed
data.oracle_text: {2}{U}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
data.flavor_text: In water, it's as graceful as a dolphin. On land, it darts and jerks so unpredictably that few can ride it for long.

data.name: Arashin War Beast
data.oracle_text: Whenever Arashin War Beast deals combat damage to one or more blocking creatures, manifest the top card of your library. (Put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

data.name: Arashin War Beast
data.oracle_text: Whenever Arashin War Beast deals combat damage to one or more blocking creatures, manifest the top card of your library. (Put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

data.name: Arborback Stomper
data.oracle_text:
Trample
When Arborback Stomper enters the battlefield, you gain 5 life.
data.flavor_text: The power of aether draws creatures to it like a magnetic force, and those that are touched by it are forever altered.

data.name: Arboreal Grazer
data.oracle_text:
Reach
When Arboreal Grazer enters the battlefield, you may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped.
data.flavor_text:
"We fight to stop a tyrant, but we also fight for the gentle creatures who have no concept of what befalls their world."
—Vivien Reid

data.name: Arc-Slogger
data.oracle_text: {R}, Exile the top ten cards of your library: Arc-Slogger deals 2 damage to any target.
data.flavor_text: A shuffling sound and the smell of ozone follow the slogger as surely as its electric tail.

data.name: Armguard Familiar
data.oracle_text:
Ward {2} (Whenever this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays {2}.)
Equipped creature gets +2/+1 and has ward {2}.
Reconfigure {4} ({4}: Attach to target creature you control; or unattach from a creature. Reconfigure only as a sorcery. While attached, this isn't a creature.)

data.name: Ashen Firebeast
data.oracle_text: {1}{R}: Ashen Firebeast deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
data.flavor_text:
"I'm not sure which impresses me most, its thoroughness or its intensity."
—Matoc, lavamancer

data.name: Assault Zeppelid
data.oracle_text: Flying, trample
data.flavor_text:
"Show them to Razia and then to the Azorius sky marshals. We could create a fine bidding war—enough to fund the final stages of Project Kraj."
—Momir Vig

data.name: Aura Gnarlid
data.oracle_text:
Creatures with power less than Aura Gnarlid's power can't block it.
Aura Gnarlid gets +1/+1 for each Aura on the battlefield.
data.flavor_text: Kill a gnarlid with your first blow, or it'll cheerfully show you how it's done.

data.name: Auspicious Starrix
data.oracle_text:
Mutate {5}{G} (If you cast this spell for its mutate cost, put it over or under target non-Human creature you own. They mutate into the creature on top plus all abilities from under it.)
Whenever this creature mutates, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile X permanent cards, where X is the number of times this creature has mutated. Put those permanent cards onto the battlefield.

data.name: Auspicious Starrix
data.oracle_text:
Mutate {5}{G} (If you cast this spell for its mutate cost, put it over or under target non-Human creature you own. They mutate into the creature on top plus all abilities from under it.)

data.name: Avarax

Haste
When Avarax enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a card named Avarax, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
{1}{R}: Avarax gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

data.name: Axebane Beast
data.flavor_text:
"Imagine a gigantic pine cone that's extremely territorial and always in a foul mood."
—Zhosmir, urban huntmaster

data.name: Baloth Gorger
data.oracle_text:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
If Baloth Gorger was kicked, it enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
data.flavor_text: A baloth only cares about the many things it eats and the few things that eat it.

data.name: Baloth Null
data.oracle_text: When Baloth Null enters the battlefield, return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
data.flavor_text:
"Humans use pigs to hunt for mushrooms, don't they? It's like that."
—Harak, Malakir bloodwitch

data.name: Baloth Packhunter
data.oracle_text:
Trample
When Baloth Packhunter enters the battlefield, put two +1/+1 counters on each other creature you control named Baloth Packhunter.

data.name: Baloth Pup
data.oracle_text: Baloth Pup has trample as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.
data.flavor_text: A young baloth channels its energy into playful destructiveness. Over time, it becomes less playful but no less destructive.

data.name: Baloth Woodcrasher
data.oracle_text: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, Baloth Woodcrasher gets +4/+4 and gains trample until end of turn.
data.flavor_text: Its insatiable hunger quickly depletes a region of prey. It must migrate from place to place to feed its massive bulk.

data.name: Bannerhide Krushok
data.oracle_text:
Trample
Reinforce 2—{1}{G} ({1}{G}, Discard this card: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature.)
Scavenge {5}{G}{G} ({5}{G}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)

data.name: Barbarian Outcast
data.oracle_text: When you control no Swamps, sacrifice Barbarian Outcast.
data.flavor_text:
"We offer power to anyone willing to take it. Sadly, few are unburdened enough by their prejudices to accept."
—Cabal surgeon

data.name: Barkhide Mauler
data.oracle_text: Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
data.flavor_text: Anywhere else they would be hunted for their skins, but in Wirewood, they are safe.

data.name: Batterhorn
data.oracle_text: When Batterhorn enters the battlefield, you may destroy target artifact.
data.flavor_text: Novice shopkeeps spend hours deciding how best to display their wares. Veterans focus on portability.

data.name: Battering Craghorn
data.oracle_text:
First strike
Morph {1}{R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
data.flavor_text: Their skeletons can be found all over Skirk Ridge, tangled in each other's horns.

data.name: Battering Krasis
data.oracle_text:
Trample
Evolve (Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if that creature has greater power or toughness than this creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)

data.name: Battlefront Krushok
data.oracle_text:
Battlefront Krushok can't be blocked by more than one creature.
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it can't be blocked by more than one creature.
data.flavor_text: Krushoks clear debris from fertile fields, fallow fields, and battlefields.

data.name: Bazaar Krovod
data.oracle_text: Whenever Bazaar Krovod attacks, another target attacking creature gets +0/+2 until end of turn. Untap that creature.
data.flavor_text: The Hauler's Collective wields great influence over the Ravnican merchant class. Without it, little moves in the city.

data.name: Beacon Behemoth
data.oracle_text: {1}: Target creature with power 5 or greater gains vigilance until end of turn.
data.flavor_text: When its smoky plumes light Naya's sky, every creature from the smallest pip fawn to the largest rannet heeds the warning.

data.name: Beast in Show
data.oracle_text: Trample
data.flavor_text: "A stunning example of the breed! Flawless plating, ruthlessly efficient death stroke, and an excellent drool shimmer."

data.name: Beast in Show
data.oracle_text: Trample
data.flavor_text: "We've not seen one of these on the podium for many seasons. Such magnificent posture and the perfect amount of telltale odor."

data.name: Beast in Show
data.oracle_text: Trample
data.flavor_text: "Something really special in the baloth category this season, in terms of spike density and quality. We'd like to get a word with the handler, but are unable to locate her at this time."

data.name: Beast in Show
data.oracle_text: Trample
data.flavor_text: "Not a surprise to see her on the podium. This paragon of tusk curvature is just the latest addition to the long championship lineage of Wildspeaker Ranch."

data.name: Beasts of Bogardan
data.oracle_text:
Protection from red
Beasts of Bogardan gets +1/+1 as long as an opponent controls a nontoken white permanent.
data.flavor_text: Bogardan is a land as volatile as the creatures who live there.

data.name: Beast Walkers
data.oracle_text: {G}: Beast Walkers gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
data.flavor_text:
"The Beast Walkers do a great service to Aysen. As humans or as beasts, their heart is yet to Serra true."
—Baris, Serra Inquisitor

data.name: Berserk Murlodont
data.oracle_text: Whenever a Beast becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
data.flavor_text:
"The harder we press forward, the harder Krosa pushes us back."
—Aven scout

Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

data.name: Blight-Breath Catoblepas
data.oracle_text: When Blight-Breath Catoblepas enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is your devotion to black. (Each {B} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to black.)
data.flavor_text: Wherever it walks, famine follows behind.

data.name: Blind Creeper
data.oracle_text: Whenever a player casts a spell, Blind Creeper gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
data.flavor_text: It shuns everything except its next meal.

data.name: Blossoming Bogbeast
data.oracle_text: Whenever Blossoming Bogbeast attacks, you gain 2 life. Then creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the amount of life you gained this turn.
data.flavor_text:
As subtle as a bogbeast
—Witherbloom expression meaning
"crude and clumsy"

data.name: Bog Gnarr
data.oracle_text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, Bog Gnarr gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
data.flavor_text: Not all of Dominaria's defenders were nourished by the light.

data.name: Bogstomper
data.flavor_text:
"They are gentle herbivores, despite their size. Approach cautiously, and hum a tune to let them know you mean no harm."
—Vivien Reid

data.name: Bonethorn Valesk
data.oracle_text: Whenever a permanent is turned face up, Bonethorn Valesk deals 1 damage to any target.
data.flavor_text: Barbarians weave its spurs into ceremonial charms to proclaim their hardiness in battle.

Trample
Whenever Book Devourer deals combat damage to a player, you may discard all the cards in your hand. If you do, draw that many cards.
data.flavor_text: "Not my first edition of *The Advokist and the Urchin*!"

"I have a number of hyper-specific phobias and this somehow hits all of them."
—Aaru, Zagoth lumberjack

{1}{B}: Return Brackish Trudge from your graveyard to your hand. Activate only if you gained life this turn.

Trample

data.name: Bulette

data.flavor_text: Capable of moving swiftly through even tightly-packed earth and leaping surprising distances above ground, bulettes are difficult to escape once they've caught scent of prey.

data.name: Bulette
data.oracle_text: At the beginning of your end step, if a creature died this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Bulette.

data.flavor_text: For millennia they wandered from plane to plane, devouring all metal. Finally, their wanderings are over.

When Craterhoof Behemoth enters the battlefield, creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creatures you control.
data.flavor_text: Its footsteps of today are the lakes of tomorrow.

data.oracle_text:
Haste
When Craterhoof Behemoth enters the battlefield, creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creatures you control.

data.name: Creature Guy
data.oracle_text: Gotcha — If an opponent says "creature" or "guy," you may say "Gotcha!" When you do, return Creature Guy from your graveyard to your hand.
data.flavor_text: There once was a player named Quinn, . . .

data.name: Crested Craghorn
data.oracle_text:
Haste
Provoke (Whenever this creature attacks, you may have target creature defending player controls untap and block it if able.)
data.flavor_text:
"Craghorns experience a wide range of emotions: rage, fury, anger . . ."
—Foothill guide

data.name: Cryptic Annelid
data.oracle_text: When Cryptic Annelid enters the battlefield, scry 1, then scry 2, then scry 3. (To scry X, look at the top X cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

data.name: Cultivator Colossus
data.oracle_text:
Trample
Cultivator Colossus's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.
When Cultivator Colossus enters the battlefield, you may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped. If you do, draw a card and repeat this process.

data.name: Cystbearer
data.oracle_text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
data.flavor_text: Phyrexia strives to simulate natural life, but it can't resist improving on the design.

data.name: Darba
data.oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Darba unless you pay {G}{G}.
data.flavor_text: Legend has it the darba gave up its wings in return for an extra stomach.

data.name: Deathbringer Thoctar
data.oracle_text:
Whenever another creature dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Deathbringer Thoctar.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Deathbringer Thoctar: It deals 1 damage to any target.

data.name: Deathmist Raptor
data.oracle_text:
Deathtouch
Whenever a permanent you control is turned face up, you may return Deathmist Raptor from your graveyard to the battlefield face up or face down.
Megamorph {4}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

data.name: Deepwood Tantiv
data.oracle_text: Whenever Deepwood Tantiv becomes blocked, you gain 2 life.
data.flavor_text: A single tantiv is just as dangerous as a herd.

data.name: Desert Cerodon
data.oracle_text: Cycling {R} ({R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
data.flavor_text: The endless expanse of desert surrounding Naktamun sometimes yields threats that the gods themselves must answer.

data.name: Displacer Beast
data.oracle_text:
When Displacer Beast enters the battlefield, venture into the dungeon. (Enter the first room or advance to the next room.)
Displacement — {3}{U}: Return Displacer Beast to its owner's hand.
data.flavor_text: The only place you can be sure it's not is wherever it appears to be.

data.name: Displacer Beast
data.oracle_text:
When Displacer Beast enters the battlefield, venture into the dungeon. (Enter the first room or advance to the next room.)
Displacement — {3}{U}: Return Displacer Beast to its owner's hand.

data.name: Displacer Kitten
data.oracle_text: Avoidance — Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, exile up to one target nonland permanent you control, then return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
data.set_name: Commander Legends: Battle for Baldur's Gate
data.flavor_text:
"Isn't she the cutest thing you've almost seen?"
—Doen, purveyor of exotic pets

data.name: Domri's Nodorog
data.oracle_text:
Trample
When Domri's Nodorog enters the battlefield, you may search your library and/or graveyard for a card named Domri, City Smasher, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you search your library this way, shuffle.
data.flavor_text: "Good girl."

data.name: Dreg Reaver
data.flavor_text:
"On our thirty-fourth day of digging, we unearthed a chamber that contained the intact remains of several species long extinct from Grixis. One in particular should make a fine siege engine . . . ."
—Last notes of Shungus Nod, fleshcrafter

data.name: Drekavac
data.oracle_text: When Drekavac enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a noncreature card.
data.flavor_text: Like a vulture's scalp, the face of a drekavac is oily and hairless. The filth and disease of its carrion diet slip off its blood-slick skin.

data.name: Dromad Purebred
data.oracle_text: Whenever Dromad Purebred is dealt damage, you gain 1 life.
data.flavor_text:
"I have seen much from the back of my dromad, most of it terribly wrong. The more I see, the more I am convinced of the rightness of my path."
—Heruj, Selesnya initiate

data.name: Drooling Groodion
data.oracle_text: {2}{B}{G}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Another target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
data.flavor_text:
"The Golgari expand, yes, but I refuse to call their tainted creations 'growth.'"
—Veszka, Selesnya evangel

data.name: Durkwood Baloth
data.oracle_text: Suspend 5—{G} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {G} and exile it with five time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

data.name: Earthshaking Si
data.oracle_text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
data.set_name: Global Series Jiang Yanggu & Mu Yanling
data.flavor_text:
"For reasons unknown to me, herds in the Arrow Bamboo Forest have become more and more agitated."
—Jiang Yanggu's travelogue

data.name: Elder Gargaroth
data.oracle_text:
Vigilance, reach, trample
Whenever Elder Gargaroth attacks or blocks, choose one —
• Create a 3/3 green Beast creature token.
• You gain 3 life.
• Draw a card.

data.name: Electryte
data.oracle_text: Whenever Electryte deals combat damage to defending player, it deals damage equal to its power to each blocking creature.
data.flavor_text: Shivan inhabitants are hardened to fire, so their predators have developed alternative weaponry.

data.name: Ember Beast
data.oracle_text: Ember Beast can't attack or block alone.
data.flavor_text: The only livestock that will survive for long in the Smelting District, ember beasts serve many functions—none of them willingly.

data.name: Ember Beast
data.oracle_text: Ember Beast can't attack or block alone.
data.flavor_text:
Spot one ember beast, attack.
Spot a second, best fall back.
—Dwarven saying

data.name: Enormous Baloth
data.flavor_text: Its diet consists of fruits, plants, small woodland animals, large woodland animals, woodlands, fruit groves, fruit farmers, and small cities.

data.name: Erithizon
data.oracle_text: Whenever Erithizon attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature of defending player's choice.
data.flavor_text: Unlike scorpions, the erithizon isn't immune to its own weaponry.

data.name: Essence Symbiote
data.oracle_text: Whenever a creature you control mutates, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature and you gain 2 life.
data.flavor_text: The Ozolith's appearance spawned a new era of wild mutation on Ikoria. Some creatures hunted different prey, lived in new habitats, and thrived on mutation itself.

card_faces.name: Ettercap
card_faces.flavor_text:
"Filthy, sticky, vile, noxious—and I haven't even started describing the webs."
—Erinis, gloom stalker

data.flavor_text:
"Filthy, sticky, vile, noxious—and I haven't even started describing the webs."
—Erinis, gloom stalker

data.name: Excavating Anurid
data.oracle_text:
When Excavating Anurid enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a land. If you do, draw a card.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Excavating Anurid gets +1/+1 and has vigilance.
data.flavor_text: Turg's spawn ruled long after he croaked.

data.name: Fangren Firstborn
data.oracle_text: Whenever Fangren Firstborn attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on each attacking creature.
data.flavor_text: In the Tangle, bad is often followed by worse.

data.name: Fangren Hunter
data.oracle_text: Trample
data.flavor_text: Big ones hunt the elves, so the elves hunt the small ones to keep them from getting big.

data.name: Fangren Marauder
data.oracle_text: Whenever an artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may gain 5 life.
data.flavor_text:
"The fangren fight without comfort of any kind. We can ask no less of ourselves."
—Tilien, Sylvok partisan

data.name: Fangren Pathcutter
data.oracle_text: Whenever Fangren Pathcutter attacks, attacking creatures gain trample until end of turn.
data.flavor_text:
"Tracking a fangren pack is easy. Catching up to one is fatal."
—Viridian scout

data.name: Felidar Cub
data.oracle_text: Sacrifice Felidar Cub: Destroy target enchantment.
data.flavor_text: Felidars that make it through their first year of life can easily live to see a hundred years more.

data.name: Felidar Guardian
data.oracle_text: When Felidar Guardian enters the battlefield, you may exile another target permanent you control, then return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
data.flavor_text: The loyalty of a felidar is hard won but worth the effort.

data.name: Felidar Sovereign
data.oracle_text:
Vigilance, lifelink
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 40 or more life, you win the game.

data.name: Feral Hydra

Feral Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
{3}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Feral Hydra. Any player may activate this ability.
data.flavor_text: It shreds its prey as each head fights for the choicest bits.

data.name: Feral Krushok
data.flavor_text: In a stunning act of diplomacy, Yasova Dragonclaw ceded a portion of Temur lands to the Sultai. Her clan protested until they saw she had given the Sultai the breeding grounds of the krushoks. They hadn't realized she had a sense of humor.

data.name: Feral Throwback
data.oracle_text:
Amplify 2 (As this creature enters the battlefield, put two +1/+1 counters on it for each Beast card you reveal in your hand.)
Provoke (Whenever this creature attacks, you may have target creature defending player controls untap and block it if able.)

data.set_name: Global Series Jiang Yanggu & Mu Yanling
data.flavor_text: Known for their glowing horn and stone-rattling roar, zheng are the fiercest predators in the forest. Few survived before Jiang Yanggu came.

data.flavor_text: The Vulshok use its digestion to break down the most obstinate artifacts, from darksteel myr to seastrider plates.

{T}: Fledgling Mawcor deals 1 damage to any target.

data.flavor_text: Flowstone troops are notoriously difficult to keep in formation.

data.name: Frenetic Raptor

"How do you stop a raptor from charging? No, seriously! Help!"
—Blarg, goblin jester

data.name: Frondland Felidar

data.flavor_text:
"Fear not the behemoth heard from miles away. Fear the stalking felidar, which reveals itself only for the kill."
—Rielle, the Everwise

Flying

{U}: Target creature becomes blue until end of turn.

data.name: Galvanoth
data.oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. You may cast it without paying its mana cost if it's an instant or sorcery spell.
data.flavor_text: It chews open Mirrodin's husk and feeds on the outpouring of energy.

data.name: Gang of Elk
data.oracle_text: Whenever Gang of Elk becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
data.flavor_text:
"I felt the ground shake, so I hid in my tent until the earthquake passed. It passed all right, and it left hoofprints."
—Femeref explorer

data.name: Gang of Elk
data.oracle_text: Whenever Gang of Elk becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
data.flavor_text: The elk is Gaea's favorite, who wears the forest on its brow.

Suspend 4—{1}{R} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{R} and exile it with four time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

Trample

data.flavor_text: Intent: Magic has made a Grater Gargadon and a Lesser Gargadon (see ref). We want you to design the "average" Gargadon.

data.name: Garruk's Packleader
data.oracle_text: Whenever another creature with power 3 or greater enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card.

"He has learned much in his long years. And unlike selfish humans, he's willing to share."
—Garruk Wildspeaker
